sub_title: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande
summary: As Area Manager I am responsible for developing sustainable business with airport and parcel customers in the Nordcis by developing and shaping of opportunities, offering valuable propositions and building long-term partnerships.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande
Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Oslo Gardermoen Airport T1 Enabling Works
projects.description: Managing a program of multiple brownfield projects at Oslo Gardermoen Airport to maximize the capacity, efficiency and functionality of the T2 BHS in order to enable a replacement of the T1 BHS with minimum effect on the airport operations.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Göteborg Landvetter Airport Scheme Design
projects.description: Managing the Scheme Design for Göteborg Landvetter Airport (GOT) that will deliver layouts, simulations and planning of execution for a series of extensions to the current BHS in order to keep up with the demand for additional make-up positions and achieve compliance to ECAC STD 3.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Göteborg Landvetter Airport Make Up Extension
projects.description:
The goal of this project was to add make-up capacity to the current BHS by adding a new final sorter with 12 chutes and 2 carousels equipped with automatic lifting aids capable of handling respectively loose load and containerized load.

The new final sorter had to be fully integrated within the current operational BHS without affecting the ongoing operations.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Key Program: Organizational Readiness
projects.description:
Vanderlande established 7 Key Programs to capture the defined growth opportunities in an accelerated way.

The goal of the Organizational Readiness Key Program is to prepare Vanderlande for the growth that is coming through increasing and balancing worldwide capacity and capabilities. My responsibly was to manage the global implementation and execution of a quarterly cycle of growth plans.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Sabiha Gokcen International Airport Transfer Line and Additional Chutes
projects.description: As a result of the increasing flow of Transfer baggage at Sabiha Gokcen International Airport, Vanderlande will relieve the BHS from the Transfer baggage pressure by adding an additional Transfer line  with a 1200 b/hr capacity to the system. Moreover, the existing Sorter will see an addition of 20 Chutes.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Edinburgh Airport Scheme Design
projects.description:
Delivering the Scheme for a project that encompasses the replacement of Edinburgh Airport’s (EDI) entire existing BHS system. The new BHS system will be fully compliant with ECAC Standard 3 and will increase the capacity of the BHS in line with EDI’s projected growth in passenger numbers. 

The main challenge of the project will be the fact that the whole airport needs to remain operational with minimal loss of capacity during the transiting from the existing to the new BHS system.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Sabiha Gokcen International Airport Extension of Check-in Islands G-H
projects.description:
In order to cope with the growing passenger numbers at Sabiha Gokcen International Airport, this project encompasses the extension of check-in islands G-H with 6 additional check-in positions.

The main challenge of this project is creating and following up on a strict day-to-day installation schedule as all works had to be conducted within the main Departure area during airport operating hours. Of course without causing disturbances to the passengers.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Göteborg Landvetter Airport Arrivals Extension
projects.description:
The current Arrival Hall at Goteborg Landvetter Airport is in use since 2007 and was built with a maximum annual capacity of 5.400.000 passengers in mind. Already in 2015, the annual number of passengers surpassed the 6.000.000 and therefore Goteborg Landvetter Airport decided on opening a new Arrival Hall in 2017.

Vanderlande will deliver two new Arrival Carousel (one Tilted and one Flat) to bring the total amount of Arrival Carousels in the new Arrival Hall to five. Special feature of this project is that both Carousels will be equipped with a lifting aid solution for unloading in the public area.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Ataturk Airport Extension
projects.description:
Delivering the Baggage Handling System for the extension of the current Ataturk Airport in Istanbul. The extension building has to add capacity to the current facilities and will be dedicated to seasonal/charter flights and houses a stand-alone Baggage Handling System with a design capacity of 2400 bags/hour.

Vanderlande's system will consist of 40 check-in positions leading to one of the two make-up carousel. The screening concept for departing baggage is based on the Standard-3 concept with 2 in-line Screening Machines. The delivery of a CCTV system, linked to the BHS SCADA is also within scope.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Ashgabat Airport
projects.description:
Delivering the Baggage Handling System for Ashgabat Airport, a new 350.000 m2 terminal to be build in Turkmenistan's capital city. At completion, this terminal will be able to handle 1.600 passengers/hour and is fit to grow to 14.000.000 passenger/year.

Vanderlande's system will consist of 48 check-in positions leading to one of the two Baxorters for final sorting. The screening concept for departing baggage is based on the Standard-3 concept with 4 in-ine Screening Machines. For arriving baggage one of the 7 reclaim carousels will be used.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Göteborg Landvetter Airport OOG Line and Additional Chute
projects.description:
In order for Goteborg Landvetter Airport to cope with the present growth in passenger numbers, the airport is adding one new OOG (oversize) baggage check-in position with inline screening and a new chute that will act as an additional make-up location to the existing Sorter.

Both of these additions will have to be installed and integrated to the existing BHS controls system without any interference to the normal operations.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Sabiha Gokcen International Airport Extension of Check-in Islands C-D and E-F
projects.description:
In order to cope with the growing passenger numbers at Sabiha Gokcen International Airport, this project encompasses the extension of check-in islands C-D and E-F with 6 additional check-in positions each.

The main challenge of this project is creating and following up on a strict day-to-day installation schedule as all works had to be conducted within the main Departure area during airport operating hours. Of course without causing disturbances to the passengers.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Sabiha Gokcen International Airport SAC and SCADA Retrofit
projects.description:
Replacing the Sortation Allocation Computer (SAC) and Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) of the seccond biggest airport in Istanbul: Sabiha Gokcen International Airport. The SAC controls the Sorter by making it possible to allocate bags for a certain flight to a sortation location and the SCADA makes it possible for operators to control all BHS equipment.

The biggest challenge of these IT related upgrades is to implement them with as less as possible influence on the day-to-day operations of this very crowded airport.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Ankara Esenboğa Airport Screening Machine Upgrade
projects.description:
In two phases, each with a duration of about one week, all existing seven Screening Machines at Ankara Esenboğa Airport are replaced for new ones and re-integrated with the Baggage Handling System.

The major challenge in this project was the fact that the replacement had to take place while the airport operations should continue.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande
Global Procurement Category Manager IT at AkzoNobel
Project Manager at Vanderlande

projects.title: Izmir Adnan Menderes Airport & Ankara Esenboğa Airport SAC Retrofit
projects.description:
Replacing the Sortation Allocation Computer (SAC) for the airports of two major Turkish cities: Izmir and Ankara. The SAC controls the Sorter by making it possible to allocate bags for a certain flight to a sortation location.

The biggest challenge of these SAC upgrades was to implement them with as less as possible influence on the day-to-day operations of these airports.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Hakkari Airport
projects.description:
Delivering the Baggage Handling System for Hakkari Airport, a small local airport situated near the Turkish south-eastern border. 

The Departure system consist of 9 check-in positions feeding one make-up carrousel. The Arrival system consist of two arrival carrousels.

Due to the limited time available to commissioning the system, this was done completely from remote by means of modern communication techniques and local assistance.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Ordu-Giresun Airport
projects.description:
Delivering the Baggage Handling System for Ordu-Giresun Airport, a local airport situated at the Turkish north coast, litteraly build in the Black Sea. 

The Departure system consists of 19 check-in positions (combined Domestic and International), two redundantly available in-line standard-3 screening machines and two make-up carrousels. The Arrival system consists of four arrival carrousels (two for Domestic and two for International passengers).

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

projects.title: Ağrı Airport
projects.description:
Delivering the Baggage Handling System for Ağrı Airport, a small-sized Domestic airport situated near the Turkish eastern border which is now also prepared to operate as an International airport. The airport is operated by DHMI.

The Departure system consists of 10 check-in positions (5 for Domestics and 5 for International), two redundantly available in-line screening machines and two make-up carrousels. The Arrival system consists of three arrival carrousels (one for Domestic and two for International passengers) which are feeded by means of two continuous baggage elevators covering a height difference of more than 14 meters.

These elevators where also posing a technological challenge, which we successfully tackled during this project.

contributors.headline: Senior Area Manager Nordics at Vanderlande

profile_positions.description:
Senior Area Manager for Vanderlande’s airport and parcel solutions in the Nordics with a focus on our key customers in this region.

As Senior Area Manager I am responsible for developing sustainable business with airports and parcel carriers in Northern Europe by developing and shaping of opportunities, offering valuable propositions and building long-term partnerships.
profile_positions.title: Senior Area Manager Nordics

profile_positions.description:
Area Manager for Vanderlande’s airport and parcel solutions in the Nordics with a focus on our key customers in this region.

As Area Manager I am responsible for developing sustainable business with airports and parcel carriers in Northern Europe by developing and shaping of opportunities, offering valuable propositions and building long-term partnerships.
profile_positions.title: Area Manager Nordics

profile_positions.description:
Project Manager for Baggage Handling Systems, focussed on executing challenging turn-key projects around the globe. 

As Project Manager I was responsible for creating a realistic project plan, and for following it up so that key targets like time, budget, quality and functionality are achieved. Moreover, I had overall commercial responsibility for the projects that I handled during the execution phase.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
As Project Planner I was responsible for establishing a realistic project schedule which sets priorities and reveals potential bottlenecks for the Project Manager; as well as allows him to follow up on it. In order to do so I had to coordinate with several internal stakeholders, such as: Sales, Project Management, Project Engineering, Supply Chain and Shipping Departments.

The main goal was always to make sure the project is finalized within the agreed timeline or even sooner.
profile_positions.title: Project Planner

profile_positions.description:
During my studies I worked as a ride operator for the Attractions Anderrijk, which includes: Aquanura, Bobbaan, Fata Morgana, Pandadroom, Piraña, Spookslot and Sprookjesbos.

I was also member of the "Junior Gastheren/Gastvrouwen Commissie" since October 2011. This committee stood up for the rights and interests of all 800 Junior Gastheren/Gastvrouwen working in the company.
profile_positions.title: Junior Gastheer

profile_positions.description: During my time as Junior Gastheer in the Efteling, I also supported the Efteling Planbureau department in their daily tasks. Basically, this ment that I had to steer last minute changes in the personnel planning in order to guarantee smoothless operations in the Efteling.
profile_positions.title: Junior Planner

profile_positions.description: As part of my Master of Science graduation program, I performed a research with the aim to develop a method to proactively engineer successful new products at SABIC Polymers.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis

profile_positions.description:
I was the Chairman of the International Research Project 2012. A study tour for members of Study Association Industria at the Eindhoven University of Technology. As Chairman I was responsible for the overall progress of the project.

I combined this position with my Innovation Management Master program.
profile_positions.title: Chairman IRP 2012

profile_positions.description: During my studies I performed a project with the goal to analyse whether it was possible to further reduce the setup times for the PCBA production lines in order to more efficiently use the available capacity.
profile_positions.title: Business Engineer Operations

profile_positions.description: As part of my Bachelor of Science graduation program, I was performing a research on how to increase the innovative capacity of CiBER Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor Thesis

profile_positions.description: As mentor I was guiding 15 new students in their first year at the Eindhoven Universtity of Technology.
profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for revising and grading of the assignments for the course Quality and Reliability Engineering 2.
profile_positions.title: Tutor

profile_positions.description: As part of my Bachelor of Science graduation program, I was allocating the shelf spaces for several products at the Jumbo stores based on a logistic model in order to minimize both stock and lost sales.
profile_positions.title: Data Collection and Analysis
